bug.author: lightsocks
bug.description: When i use <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/serving/blob/master/tensorflow_serving/example/resnet_client.py>resnet_client.py</denchmark-link> to invoke the REST API provided by the<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/official/resnet>model</denchmark-link> i downloaded. it returns http status 400 and "Type: Object is not of expected type: float" }" error. How to invoke it correctly.

comments.comment: can you please post complete list of commands use to start the model server (with resnet model) and the corresponding command line that you used to invoke the resnet_client.py?
Try downloading a SavedModel from there that uses JPEG as input and see if that works. Iâ€™m guessing you built or downloaded on that expects a tensor.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lightsocks>@lightsocks</denchmark-link> - Hello, is this still an issue ? Feel free to close this issue if it has been resolved.

Please see <denchmark-link:https://medium.com/tensorflow/serving-ml-quickly-with-tensorflow-serving-and-docker-7df7094aa008>this blog post</denchmark-link> for a clear example of how to use the script.
